topic: How to observe edge runtimes using fastapi with Python 3.12+
prompt: Write a Python 3.12+ focused, accurate explainer for: How to observe edge runtimes using fastapi with Python 3.12+
response_raw:
{ "title": "Observing Edge Runtimes with FastAPI in Python 3.12+", "summary": "This guide demonstrates how to use FastAPI to monitor edge runtime execution times in Python 3.12+, enhancing the performance of your applications.", "key_points": [ "FastAPI is a modern web framework for building APIs with Python 3.12+", "Edge runtimes allow for optimized deployment and scaling of FastAPI applications", "Monitoring edge runtime execution times can help improve your application's performance", "This explainer focuses on using the built-in tools in FastAPI and FastAPI's Profiler Middleware" ], "code_examples": [ { "language": "python", "code": "from fastapi import FastAPI, Depends\napp = FastAPI()\n\nfrom fastapi.openrpc.managers import OpenApiManager\nmanager = OpenApiManager.\napp.include_router(manager.get_router())" }, { "language": "python", "code": "from fastapi.middleware.profiler import ProfilerMiddleware\n\napp = FastAPI()\n\napp.add_middleware(ProfilerMiddleware)" }, { "language": "python", "code": "from fastapi.responses import HTMLResponse\n\ndef profile_html(start_time: float, end_time: float, function_calls: dict):\n return HTMLResponse(content=\"" + " \n" + " \n" + " \n" + " \n" + " FastAPI Profiler\n" + " \n" + " \n" + "

FastAPI Profiler Results

\n" + " 
\n" +
             "                Total runtime: {:.6f} seconds\n".format(end_time - start_time) + "\n" +
             "                Function calls:\n" + "\n".join("{}: {}".format(k, v) for k, v in sorted(function_calls.items())) + "\n" +
             "
\n" + " \n" + " " + ")" } ], "version_notes": [ "Python 3.12+ is required for this example", "FastAPI version >= 0.75.0 is recommended to utilize the Profiler Middleware" ], "caveats": [ "The Profiler Middleware may have a performance impact on your application, so it's best to use it sparingly or in development environments", "Edge runtimes might not support certain features, leading to differences in behavior compared to local testing" ] }
